00040 class RadiusMargin : public ErrorFunction
00041 {

00055         double error(Model& model, const Array<double>& input, const Array<double>& target)
00056         {
00057                 SVM* pSVM = NULL;
00058                 double Cplus, Cminus;
00059                 bool norm2;
00060 
00061                 // check the model type
00062                 C_SVM* csvm = dynamic_cast<C_SVM*>(&model);
00063                 if (csvm == NULL)
00064                         throw "[RadiusMargin::error] model is not a valid C_SVM.";
00065 
00066                 Array<double> tmp;
00067                 csvm->model(input[0], tmp);                     // copy the parameters into the kernel
00068                 Cplus = csvm->get_Cplus();
00069                 Cminus = csvm->get_Cminus();
00070                 norm2 = csvm->is2norm();
00071                 pSVM = csvm->getSVM();
00072 
00073                 // compute the coefficients alpha and beta
00074                 Array<double> alpha;
00075                 Array<double> beta;
00076                 solveProblems(pSVM, Cplus, Cminus, input, target, alpha, beta, norm2);
00077 
00078                 KernelFunction* kernel = pSVM->getKernel();
00079                 unsigned int i, j, examples = input.dim(0);
00080                 double R2, w2;
00081                 double kv;
00082                 double bi, bj;
00083 
00084                 w2 = 0.0;
00085                 R2 = 0.0;
00086                 for (j=0; j<examples; j++)
00087                 {
00088                         bj = beta(j);
00089                         for (i=0; i<examples; i++)
00090                         {
00091                                 bi = beta(i);
00092                                 kv = kernel->eval(input[i], input[j]);
00093                                 if (i == j && norm2)
00094                                 {
00095                                         if (target(i) > 0.0) kv += 1.0 / csvm->get_Cplus();
00096                                         else kv += 1.0 / csvm->get_Cminus();
00097                                 }
00098 
00099                                 R2 -= bi * bj * kv;
00100                                 if (i == j)
00101                                 {
00102                                         w2 += alpha(i);
00103                                         R2 += bi * kv;
00104                                 }
00105                         }
00106                 }
00107                 return R2 * w2;
00108         }

00116         double errorDerivative(Model& model, const Array<double>& input, const Array<double>& target, Array<double>& derivative)
00117         {
00118                 SVM* pSVM = NULL;
00119                 double Cplus, Cminus;
00120                 bool norm2;
00121 
00122                 // check the model type
00123                 C_SVM* csvm = dynamic_cast<C_SVM*>(&model);
00124                 if (csvm == NULL)
00125                         throw "[RadiusMargin::errorDerivative] model is not a valid C_SVM or C_SVM2.";
00126 
00127                 Array<double> tmp;
00128                 csvm->model(input[0], tmp);                     // copy the parameters into the kernel
00129                 Cplus = csvm->get_Cplus();
00130                 Cminus = csvm->get_Cminus();
00131                 norm2 = csvm->is2norm();
00132                 pSVM = csvm->getSVM();
00133 
00134                 // compute the coefficients alpha and beta
00135                 Array<double> alpha;
00136                 Array<double> beta;
00137                 solveProblems(pSVM, Cplus, Cminus, input, target, alpha, beta, norm2);
00138 
00139                 KernelFunction* kernel = pSVM->getKernel();
00140                 unsigned int i, j, examples = input.dim(0);
00141                 unsigned int k, kc = kernel->getParameterDimension();
00142                 double R2, w2;
00143                 double kv;
00144                 double ayi, ayj, bi, bj;
00145                 Array<double> dw2(kc);
00146                 Array<double> dR2(kc);
00147                 Array<double> dkv(kc);
00148                 derivative.resize(kc + 1, false);
00149 
00150                 w2 = 0.0;
00151                 dw2 = 0.0;
00152                 R2 = 0.0;
00153                 dR2 = 0.0;
00154                 double dR2dCplus = 0.0;
00155                 double dR2dCminus = 0.0;
00156                 double dw2dCplus = 0.0;
00157                 double dw2dCminus = 0.0;
00158                 for (j=0; j<examples; j++)
00159                 {
00160                         ayj = alpha(j) * target(j);
00161                         bj = beta(j);
00162                         for (i=0; i<examples; i++)
00163                         {
00164                                 ayi = alpha(i) * target(i);
00165                                 bi = beta(i);
00166                                 kv = kernel->evalDerivative(input[i], input[j], dkv);
00167                                 if (i == j)
00168                                 {
00169                                         if (norm2)
00170                                         {
00171                                                 double invC;
00172                                                 if (target(i) > 0.0)
00173                                                 {
00174                                                         invC = 1.0 / csvm->get_Cplus();
00175                                                         kv += invC;
00176                                                         dR2dCplus -= bi * invC * invC;
00177                                                         dw2dCplus += (ayi * ayi) * invC * invC;
00178                                                 }
00179                                                 else
00180                                                 {
00181                                                         invC = 1.0 / csvm->get_Cminus();
00182                                                         kv += invC;
00183                                                         dR2dCminus -= (bi - bi * bi) * invC * invC;
00184                                                         dw2dCminus += (ayi * ayi) * invC * invC;
00185                                                 }
00186                                         }
00187                                         w2 += alpha(i);
00188                                         R2 += bi * kv;
00189                                         for (k=0; k<kc; k++) dR2(k) += bi * dkv(k);
00190                                 }
00191                                 R2 -= bi * bj * kv;
00192                                 for (k=0; k<kc; k++)
00193                                 {
00194                                         dw2(k) -= ayi * ayj * dkv(k);
00195                                         dR2(k) -= bi * bj * dkv(k);
00196                                 }
00197                         }
00198                 }
00199 
00200                 if (norm2)
00201                 {
00202                         double cr = csvm->getCRatio();
00203                         derivative(0) = R2 * (dw2dCplus + cr * dw2dCminus) + w2 * (dR2dCplus + cr * dR2dCminus);
00204                 }
00205                 else
00206                 {
00207                         derivative(0) = 0.0;
00208                 }
00209                 for (k=0; k<kc; k++) derivative(k + 1) = R2 * dw2(k) + w2 * dR2(k);
00210 
00211                 return R2 * w2;
00212         }

00214 protected:
00217         void solveProblems(SVM* pSVM, double Cplus, double Cminus, const Array<double>& input, const Array<double>& target, Array<double>& alpha, Array<double>& beta, bool norm2)
00218         {
00219                 unsigned int i, examples = input.dim(0);
00220                 KernelFunction* kernel = pSVM->getKernel();
00221                 Array<double> ones(examples);
00222                 Array<double> inf(examples);
00223                 Array<double> C(examples);
00224                 Array<double> diag(examples);
00225                 double tmp;
00226                 C_Solver* pSolver;
00227 
00228                 alpha.resize(examples, false);
00229                 beta.resize(examples, false);
00230                 alpha = 0.0;
00231                 beta = 1.0 / examples;
00232                 ones = 1.0;
00233                 inf = 1e100;
00234                 for (i=0; i<examples; i++)
00235                 {
00236                         C(i) = (target(i) > 0.0) ? Cplus : Cminus;
00237                         diag(i) = kernel->eval(input[i], input[i]);
00238                 }
00239 
00240                 // solve the first problem to obtain the alpha coefficients
00241                 pSolver = new C_Solver(kernel, input, target, ones, target, C, alpha, tmp, false, 100, 0.001, "", true, norm2);
00242                 delete pSolver;
00243 
00244                 // solve the second problem to obtain the beta coefficients
00245                 if (norm2)
00246                         pSolver = new C_Solver(kernel, input, diag, ones, ones, C, beta, tmp, false, 100, 0.001, "", true, norm2);
00247                 else
00248                         pSolver = new C_Solver(kernel, input, diag, ones, ones, inf, beta, tmp, false, 100, 0.001, "", true, norm2);
00249                 delete pSolver;
00250         }
00251 };
